lines.text: Your mother was a cash register!
And she turned a tidy profit.
[last lines]
It is not the end. It is not the beginning of the end. It is the end of the beginning.
Sherman, come with us!
There is no place for me where you are going. Go now.
[Solemly stays behind to close up the time portal and is vaporized in the timequake]
You're the best thing in a thousand years, Bill.
You're talking about changing the past, and I know damn well we can't change the past! It catches up to us, and changes us!
Well, we haven't changed much. We're all still dying, this place still stinks, and you are still as ugly as ever!

[Louise and Bill have gotten into Louise's sports car; Louise rockets out of the parking space]
Tower clear you for that take-off?
What happens when the gate's gone?
Like a nuclear bomb!

[to Bill]
Watch that first step... it's a killer!

[last words]
I knew I was right.

[the escalator on which Louise and Bill are riding has just stopped]
Well, we could be stuck here for hours. Maybe we'd better get acquainted.
We scientists should get out of the lab more often; we might learn something!
Louise, be subtle.
Louise is as subtle as a lead pipe.
Where's my free will in all this?
Have you lost it? I will look around for it.
they don't want to be found. You must look for them in places where no one is. Or where there are people no one will ever see alive again.
Never sleep with anyone who's crazier than you are. I don't know if you're crazier, but you're right up there on the top 10 of my weird list, lady.
If you knew me better, I'd be number one.

[about Bill]
He recognised me. I guess I'm going to meet him.
[Louise is driving like a maniac; Bill is marveling that she has not killed them both in a wreck]
How long have you had this thing?
A few months.
You must be the luckiest woman in the world.
